author: {'steamid': '76561198046277022', 'num_games_owned': 901, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1707254452}
review:
I don't think I'm close to beating the game, however I'm gonna go over what I've noticed so far. The games just kinda meh. 

There's nothing to the combat. You either shoot the enemies before they reach you at all or you facetank with melee. Enemies are waaaaay too fast imo. If they run into a slope they will literally ramp through the air. They also attack at machine gun speed which is kinda annoying.

Having to craft ammo constantly is very grindy and makes the game boring. Plus I feel that the weapons are very lack luster compared the hundreds of zombies you're pitted against. Plus there's literally 20 ft tall zombies.

The building in this game is very janky. First of all half the time you won't be able to place anything because the game just won't let you. The game will outline your builds in red when the terrain is unsuitable and it pretty much does that everywhere, The snapping in the building barely works also. Also everything has to built on a foundation and if your foundation is destroyed either everything will fall down or you won't be able to build onto that structure further. Literally any interaction with any tool including your fist can destroy a foundation. So it's very easy to destroy your entire house while trying to do so much as destroy a table and move it.
Using stairs foundations and ceilings and floors alleviated this issue.

On the bright side the map is quite large seemingly. There's a large enemy variety so far. I've seen at least 4 kinds or mutants or zombies. Plus at least 7 different animals. I haven't explored very much so I hope there's more variety going forward.
Going forward, I think I saw one new enemy.

overall the game is just functional enough to be somewhat fun. 

4.5/10 just mainly because the building sucks so bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061017083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1691466534}
review:
Wow! 10/10 experience!

And why is that? You get:
- an interesting survival game that involves new ideas of game mechanics
- calming, yet intriguing atmospheric music
- a complete game, which is rare for survival games (looking at 7 dtdt 8 years alpha)
- a really good price

The last bit is something to strongly take into account. Does the game have bugs? Yes, but a few that are not game-breaking (holding the shovel makes you dig any time you press a random key; animals' movement is a bit bugged).
Is it a bit unintuitive at the start? It is! But ofc it's important to take into account if you buy Hogwarts for 60 bucks where you expect all mechanics to be smooth or an 8 bucks game for which the price is really cheap. 

I'd say the game could be sold at even double the price and I really enjoyed it even after having played survival games that are in another league, like DayZ, 7dtd, the forest. If you like survival, this one is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198974239693', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1691264186}
review:
Not great, not terrible.

I can see that there was a lot of work put into it.
The map is vast with many different locations, enemies, "objectives" and story to discover and you have a fine variety of tools and resources. It's enough to keep you engaged and not bored, or at least not for some time. 

Yet there are many downfalls to it that don't really keep me wanting to play it further.
The main one is its absurd main objective. Everything would be fine if there only was 1 island and not 3. If they would at least be a little different from each other. The only thing that changes when going from one to another is their difficulty and the tower placement. At that point, the gameplay reached its peak annoyance.

There are also many bugs, like the shovel automatically hitting the ground whenever opening your inventory.
It's already been two times that I placed a bed and it dissapeared the next time I launched the game.
Ranged weapons don't have any projectile drop. You could basically shoot an arrow across the map if you'd want.
What's more, the sound of projectiles landing is like a dynamite exploding. Including spears and arrows.
Enemies have higher range of melee attacks than you do, which makes fighting at close hand really difficult and, in the end, not even worth it.
Yeah and the ragdoll physics are goofy.

Still, it originally was a mobile game, so taking that in mind, with all the work put into it, it's not a bad game that's kinda fun to play too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190505205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1679990513}
review: Going by the expectations of most people looking for a new game, I don't recommend this. There are better open world survival-craft games out there. The available items, progression, gameplay variety, mobile-focused design, and repetitiveness/grind are all weak points. I got this game mostly for the nostalgia (I know, it only came out in 2015) and had a some fun with it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198885837002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1629586698}
review:
As others have stated, a gem in the rough. I went out of my way to get all the achievements and I really enjoyed my play through. Overall the game is not the most polished out there but its not very buggy either; that's usually how it works out with mobile ported games. The progression is slightly repetitive being you are simply doing a similar task over and over until you beat the game but oddly enough every time you do it it feels oddly unique each time. It's a very creepy, blood warming, feeling gearing up and arriving at the next irradiated tesla tower compound to shut it down, and a relief when you finally do. There were some times where I was legitimately scared. I would call it a 'slight' horror game; meaning if you just walked around at laughed at everything you really wouldn't get scared but when you take the game seriously it will definitely freak you out. However, not all of the thrill of this game is in the horror. The looting and crafting feel really gratifying in this game, and finding a new fast travel safe house is always a treat. At the end of this game I was really happy to have played all the way through. There's no huge ending, which is to be expected from an indie studio game of this size. However, if a AAA studio got a hold of a game concept just like this one (Without flooding it with corporate greed like micro transactions) it would truly be something. If you want a break from mainstream games I would definitely recommend this one.
(pro tip - make sure you craft a shovel and go for all the buried treasure on the islands marked by the Xs on your map. they're one of the best sources of loot)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004884317', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1519782483}
review:
This game kept me sane after my mother died.

It's not very deep, it's not very complex, it has plenty of systems that have little impact on gameplay and weapons that are irrelevant by the time you find them, but it's soothing, smooth, quiet and nigh-meditative. Intuitive, easy to play, and the core mechanics are easy to understand. It gave me something to focus on while I grieved, and I am highly grateful to it for doing so.

That said, maybe wait for it to go on sale if you have literally any doubts about it at all. It IS a port from Android, after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262821460', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1701479558}
review: I love this game. Playing it is a very nostalgic experience for me personally, as I am reminded of playing it on my phone/tablet when I was younger - which is also the reason I bought the game as soon as I saw it here on Steam. If you enjoy survival/exploration games, this game might appeal to you, as it offers numerous islands, settlements, military bases and loot for you to discover. Is it worth the price, though? If I recall correctly, I got the game for around 9-10 euro, however I am unsure of the current price of the game. For me the game was worth that amount of money due to the nostalgia factor, but for someone who has never played Radiation Island before, I would recommend waiting for the game to come on sale. You're in no hurry. It's an older game, so you wont be missing out on any updates or anything of that sort. It is not a must buy per say, but I still think you should give the game a try, as it is a lot of fun, and offers a lot of different experiences and opportunities for exploration and base building etc...

author: {'steamid': '76561197978612379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1655940435}
review:
The game has many problems :
- only a furnace, a bed and chests to place in your base (a 1x1 base is enough lol)
- tools are breaking after 10 hits
- gameplay very clunky
- base building bugged (have to jump to go through a door, the walls dont connect well...)
- can't move furniture
- radiation suit and radiation pills not working (so can't enter towers)

Else it could a nice game, but it ruins the game experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131614204', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1653624222}
review:
I remember back when I discovered this game on the iOS App Store and played it a while ago around when I first made my Steam account, but I never finished it. A week ago at the time of writing I discovered that it was on Steam! After 14 Hours I have to say I really liked this game and I want to voice out what I liked about it and what I think it was missing:

-------

PROS:
THE STORY - The story is very interesting! You start out as a man on a ship that is rumored to be the USS Eldridge from the Philidelphia Experiment urban legend, and you are the only one that escaped alive as it teleports back in time and to an alternate reality. You find yourself on an island dubbed "Radiation Island" in control of the Japanese Imperial Army in the middle of World War 2. In this reality, the Japanese Imperial Army was developing and testing Teleportation technology in the form of Tesla Towers but soon find out that the same towers were mutating the inhabitants of the island into aggressive and violent monsters.

BASE CONSTRUCTION - I like the idea of building your own base to survive in and this mechanic of building specifically reminds me heavily of the game "Rust". The ability to create your own base however you want brings a lot of possibilities and ideas.

ENEMY DESIGN - The enemies are what I think are the spotlight of this game; contorted and mutated enemies which seem human but at the same time... aren't. From civilians decayed to a hollow husk from radiation, to fast Japanese soldiers turned insane wielding Katanas, to horrific Hazmat doctors with giant syringes filled with infectious fluid that try to inject you, the design of these abominations is astounding. Being chased by a horde of mutated soldiers with samurai swords hellbent on slicing you to ribbons is genuinely terrifying.

-------

CONS:

ENEMY VARIETY - One of the only problems I have with this game is the fact that after you meet the 4 main mutant enemies the only mutants you find after that are just resized or recolored versions of them such as the basic Peasant zombies rescaled 7 times as large and being able to one-shot you even with the highest armor levels, or the Doctor mutants being recolored red being able to tank 2x the bullets.

REPETITIVE - The goal of disabling all the Tesla Towers on each of the 3 main islands to the 4th final island can be very tedious or boring at times since each of the 3 main islands are just the same design copied and pasted 3 times; the islands have no change in landscape as far as the layout goes besides where transit locations and where the Tesla Towers are.

--------

CONCLUSION:

Honestly I did enjoy this game but I did have a few complaints about it. I liked the Story, the Enemy Design, and the Building Mechanics, but I have some distaste for the Enemy Variety and the fact some parts are Repetitive. I do however want to see either a sequel or a remake of this game as it could really use an expansion to the story and an overhaul to the graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561199085587280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1654517765}
review: believe it or not, i played this game almost six years ago and i've never felt happier to play it again. of course, it's not that big of a game because of the buggy animals and zombies but i've always finded this game interesting and fun because of how big the map would be and how many places you would explore. Back then, i would always play this in my uncle's office with his ipad. years later, i started to forget about the game. some times i would try to remember the name but i wasnt really interested into finding it until i, today, got really curious and started to search everything i could remember of the game online. Gladly, i managed to find it and i'm happy to play it again

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435029', 'num_games_owned': 1875, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1683731740}
review:
Played on Linux using Proton, had this Game on my Mini Mac and did not know it had a Windows version, so when i saw this Game on Steams Halloween Sale it was an instant Buy and it does work with Proton.

On the Intro it had an issue with the Island flicking on and off, but once in the Game all worked well.

Graphics are okay for a sort of Mobile Game port from 2016, Sound is Good, Game Play is your normal Crafting/Survival/Puzzle/Adventure Game, This game does have 3 levels of play from very easy to Hard, Easy being more of never worry much and play at your own speed, Hard being your gonna die a lot.

I myself like this Game as i can play the Game the way i want to, Stick to the start point on the beach and run around collecting stuff and upping my inventory space and building stuff to build better weapons and ammo, and also building Tools, the other good thing with this Game is it's not overly complicated, Crafting is easy, And the Game really does help you with lots of advice.

So as you can Guess this Game is a big Recommended from Me on Linux/Proton.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039276983', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1665892288}
review: Honestly? For a mobile port, and a survival game at that, its worth the buy. There's so much more here than I thought there would be. The Island is huuuuuge, and it's got a serviceable crafting and base building system. Combat is a bit simple but uhh.. well, you can craft a boomerang that never breaks and always comes back to you. I haven't played many games that allow you to boomerang a zombie back to death. Check it out, you might have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199057312387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1627761106}
review: i loved this game it was very fun to play and everything worked out fine without any bugs or glitches. i love the weapons in this game. only complaint is that once youve been to one island youve pretty much seen it all. was excited that there were three islands that you could go into in the game cause i thought there would be lots of variety but all three islands are pretty much the same. and then at that point it just becomes a grind to finish all objectives in the game and then it ends. nevertheless it is a very fun game to play through and if you love survival horror open world craft then this game will be a decent run for you which you will probably finish in two days time. overall its really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440808812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1627447753}
review: Worth the 10 dollars. Super unique story, game design, aesthetic, and music/ambience. The ambience makes the game very scary, stress inducing, and at times, relaxing, but you are almost always looking over your shoulder. The only complaint I have is that it doesn't/hasn't gotten an update. There are often glitches (they dont effect the gameplay) and small issues that could be easily fixed, but I guess the devs haven't worked on it recently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008096350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2448, 'last_played': 1627180292}
review: enjoyable, difficulty ramps up nicely if you do the islands in the right order. i didnt and got the easy starter island followed by the hard island. that made the medium island too easy.  it would be nice if there was a hint as to which island you should go to after the first. if there was i completely missed it. maybe when you shut down the last tower on the first island another code is in the boxes to tell which way to go when you cross the centre island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157671559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1623219779}
review:
I do hope the devs port radiation city to computers as well.

This game has such a strong charm to it honestly, I don't know why I love this game but I really do. This is my second time playing the game, I first played it on my switch a few months ago and decided to buy it again on steam so I could play it on PC and support the devs. The actual graphics aren't that great, and in areas with lots of enemies it lagged on my computer a bit (though my computer isn't that powerful). I think I love the game because the colours just really pop, vibrant greens against really powerful blues. Even just dirt areas are still brightly coloured. There are also a bunch of great looking weather effects, I always like when it rains or gets foggy, and when the sun comes back I appreciate the bright colours even more.

The plot for this game is very simple, a military experiment went wrong and turned everyone on this island into monsters and zombies. I think that's all it really needed to be, and I like how it's told with short simple notes with illustrations you find around the map. I like how there's just a book item, and each one you pick up unlocks the next bit of the story, so you don't need to explore every corner of the map to get the story, I don't like when open world games have collectible documents telling the story but they're all scattered across the map and it's really hard to find them all.

I think the okay graphics and small plot really just show how much gameplay matters, because this is by far my favourite open world game I've ever played. The actual map size isn't that big, with enough fast travel points to make getting around not much of an issue, but not so many that the game becomes overly easy and generous. The game's pacing is great because you're never more than like a minute or two away from your next objective, so the open world doesn't feel annoying as much as it makes the game world feel more real. Even though the game world wasn't annoyingly big, I still thought it had a great sense of scale and size. I love how when you sleep or die there's like a shot of the island that rises up from where you are. There are also some views in the game that are just great, especially on top of the huge mountains. The change over time of your gameplay of the game is really great. You start out slowly crafting basic items and setting up a home base you can always return to, and you barely have any good weapons at all, and even a single zombie can kill you, but as the game goes on you find better and better weapons, and guns, and more ammo, and by the end of the game you have more resources than you'd ever need and the whole crafting aspect of the game kinda goes away because you're just so powerful. Even in this relatively short game the change in gameplay as you play is great. 

I love how simple the main objectives are too, basically you find notes around the game which give you de-activation codes for all the bases in the game. You just need to get into the base, type in the code and pick up the next code. It's very simple but still fun. I like how when you pick up the code it doesn't add an objective marker to your map, and you just need to find the base it's referring to by comparing the note with your in game map. You know in any AAA game you'd just get a marker popping up on your screen telling you where to go next.

On paper this is an incredibly generic open world survival game, but there's something about it that I really really love. I'd say, check it out! It's a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198379315941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1708918137}
review:
Fun survival game, great story, not the best models, and poor combat and AI thinking. 

The Surreal nature. I cannot tell you how many times I've just stopped to look at the nature and listen to the Ambience. Even when entering a tower, its haunting to see beautiful nature with an abandon military base down below. I also think this game does a great job in making you think you are truly Alone.

Atypical should come back and try to remake it one day with more crafting items, better entity models and AI code, more guns, and better physics and online accessible from the beginning. (This could be done by using Radiation City assets). It would easily be the dream survival game.

Pros:
Stunning Graphics 
Fun story based off real life events
Best soundtrack I've ever heard
Fun Combat

Cons:
Poor AI Mechanics
Bad Controls 
Very Easy to kill things
Island Elements (It rains inside, really kills the protection from the element part)
Too easy to heal (You can make a ton of medicine and be fine, it kills the use/need for pills, medkits and bandages)
Port of a Mobile game
(Anything else I am missing from here?)

Otherwise 10/10 would play again

author: {'steamid': '76561197988001805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 2990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2933, 'last_played': 1618353589}
review:
This is a very janky, mobile port of a game that has a few issues and bugs, but for some reason was still very enjoyable. Enemies are a threat, you generally don't just kill everything on sight until later in game when you actually have ammo. Although the ai is the jankiest part of this janky but still fun game.

It's an interesting open world consisting of a number of island in which you must gain pass codes to unlock the next islands. 
It has base building, crafting, looting. Nothing is done in a A+ manner. Yet i still found it to be addictive and kind of unique. 

Story wise this is also unique, i won't spoil it. The story is not huge, but it is there and quite interesting.
If you're a survival junkie, give this a go. If not, be wary, this may not be for you. It's probably not for casual gamers either as it can be a tad hard, but if you play it safely the game is easy enough. 

Beware if you hate wildlife, this game has a lot of it and they will chase you for miles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132952418', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1603020826}
review:
El juego nos muestra un mundo con diferentes grupos de enemigos. Para prosperar en el juego debemos extraer los recursos que nos da el propio mapa o los diferentes enemigos al matarlos. 

El objetivo del juego es ir desactivando las bobinas con los diferentes cÃ³digos que nos iremos encontrando por el mapa. Hay un total de tres islas con unas 6 bobinas en cada una de ellas. Algunas para desactivarlas supondrÃ¡n un reto por la cantidad de enemigos que podemos encontrar y la de recursos que tendremos que emplear.

Los grÃ¡ficos son bastante decentes, la Ãºnica pega que le podrÃ­amos sacar serÃ­a el sistema de inteligencia artificial de los mobs a veces deja un poco que desear. Por lo demÃ¡s os recomiendo probar este juego te darÃ¡ para unas 7-10 horas de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121927012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1595437050}
review:
Radiation Island is a decently port game (via Android) where you play as a unnamed male protagonist who magically gets warped into an alternate dimension version of a WWII island occupied by the WWII Japanese forces. Instead the island is called Radiation Island and it's filled with wildlife and the undead. There's even the undead version of the WWII Japanese forces. Also there are zombie doctors you have to deal with. The objective of this game is to disable all the Tesla towers and escape this alternate dimension nightmare.

All in all, this is a great survival horror indie game and I highly recommend it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053475789', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1643195937}
review:
This is an okay game I suppose, probably for it's price. Don't go into it expecting a perfect game, prob far from perfect. I think this was a mobile game? Looks like 1. 
Pros:
Zombie/Survival
A lot of loot to collect
Crafting

And now, this is what you will expect that you'll notice in game

Cons:
When you build, you have your foundations, there's a gap/indent between the next foundation you place so you'll be running through an ugly dip, same for the walls, there's a gap between next wall placement where you can walk through so I'm assuming when you build, your house should just be 1 foundation.

Rain actually goes through buildings and you see it inside. 

Enemies/animals are clunky, the AI pathing is bad, they get stuck, samurai zombies run like flash.

When you're running and you loot something off the ground, you can't move for a few seconds sometimes which is annoying when you have something chasing you.

Not sure I enjoy the fact you get enemies that can spawn right next to you

You won't get a sign that it's getting dark, it goes from light to pitch black in 2 seconds and it makes it very difficult to see anything, and then the moonlight fluctuates.

Cooking is actually done in a furnace but when your stack of food is above 17/18 it starts spitting food everywhere. 

The map was a little confusing at first, there's a sort of arrow that shows on the map, and I got lost very easy, only realised that it's a line of sight cone. 

It is playable, but it's not the best. I'm into survival games so I would probably play it every now and then.

review:
I like the art style, mood, and open world a lot in this game. I love getting lost in this creepy yet beautiful world. 

I hope that someday we can see the rest of the Radiation series on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033158310', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2118, 'last_played': 1579578048}
review: Its technically survival but there is so much loot you are never at risk of starving and you can survive the cold with just a torch.  The controls are pretty bad.  Despite what it says, it does NOT have full controller support.  It does let you remap some of its stupid defaults though but I had to use the mouse for aiming and to navigate some of the menus.  There is very little story and it doesn't impact the gameplay at all.  Its very repetitive.  After completing the first map which I though was then end I discovered there are two more where you have to do exactly the same stuff over again.  It ran smoothly with no crashes.  Its something to do if your bored and you can get it on sale for cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382338306', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1905, 'last_played': 1711887890}
review:
Game is dead and servers are down, you can play the single player open world though, the game is great, but the devs seem to be more interested in making even more money. Most of them are alright, but the higher ups seem to just not give a damn about the game anymore.

If you wnt to find a good survival game though, it is definitely here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999459739', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1567579931}
review: A lot of work went into this game, and it isn't bad, it's just not done. It is a shame there has been no update in a long time because this game is painfully close to being great. A few minor annoying bugs really detract from what is all around a decent survival game. I enjoyed playing it until the bugs kicked in and then it was painful. I hope this developer comes back and adds more content and bashes out some of these bugs to raise this game to a great game. It would not take much for me to go from not recommending this to doing so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1567109536}
review:
[h1]Radiation Island[/h1]
von 2016. Eigentlich ein Ã¼berlebens Abenteuer in einer offenen Welt.
Als Mitarbeiter am Philadelphia-Experiment bist du in einem Paralleluniversum gestrandet, zumindest zeigt das, das Intro Video das gar nicht schlecht gemacht ist.
Die Grafik ist nicht schlecht aber sie ist auch nicht gut.... Dies ist das allgemeine Problem bei diesem Spiel, alles ist nicht wirklich gut aber nix ist wirklich schlecht.
Zum Anfang ist das mit der AusrÃ¼stung eher gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig mit der Zeit wird es aber besser, mann muÃŸ erstmal dahinter kommen wie was in diesem Spiel hergestellt wird und was man wofÃ¼r woraus machen kann. Insgesamt kÃ¶nnte es umfangreicher sein da es doch nicht gerade viele Sachen zum Herstellen gibt.
Anmerkung: das Bau MenÃ¼ habe ich nicht genutzt da ich nur 4h gespielt habe... jedoch habe ich mich umgehÃ¶rt und kann euch berichten das einige Bauteile nicht so recht mit dem Untergrund zusammen passen und einige Teile auch nur schwer zusammen zu fÃ¼gen sind.
Ihr werdet wohl selbst herausfinden mÃ¼ssen wie das mit den bÃ¶sen Leuten auf dieser Insel ist, will euch ja nicht den letzten Rest Spannung nehmen, nur soviel dazu....
Diskutieren kÃ¶nnt ihr nicht mit ihnen.
So was wie eine AtmosphÃ¤re oder Aura die dich im Spiel umgibt fehlt leider vÃ¶llig, wenn man die nervige Musik mal auÃŸer acht lÃ¤sst.
Landschaftlich gesehen eignet es sich ganz gut als Walking Simulator, fÃ¼r diejenigen unter euch sage ich, ganz Ok, vor allem weil es gÃ¼nstig ist vom Preis her.
Dieses Foto habe ich beigefÃ¼gt

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1848709238

um euch besser sagen zu kÃ¶nnen wie das so ist mit dem Nahrungsverbrauch... Einmal Turm hoch durch alle leeren RÃ¤ume in einige Kisten geschaut und wieder runter.... Macht zusammen 2x Essen da ihr schon die hÃ¤lfte euer hunger Anzeige verbraucht habt. Mit anderen Worten, ihr seit gezwungen stÃ¤ndig auf Nahrungssuche zu sein und alle paar Minuten zu essen.....
Wem soll das gefallen? mir nicht....
So ist auch meine Bewertung, eher schlecht....
Da das Spiel nicht mehr im Entwicklungsstadium ist und auch sonst sich keiner mehr darum kÃ¼mmert wie es scheint rate ich eindeutig vom Kauf ab. Insbesondere da die Entwickler den PC Port aufgegeben haben. UrsprÃ¼nglich hatte ich den Daumen nach oben weil es verschiedene StartmÃ¶glichkeiten hat. Aber nachdem ich mir stundenlang Live Ãœbertragungen angesehen habe musste ich meine Entscheidung Ã¼berdenken. AuÃŸer fÃ¼r einige wenige Spieler ein klares NEIN, Nicht Kaufen.

Meine Gruppe und mein Archiv mit Ã¼ber 2.300 Reviews hier:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

und mehr Reviews von mir entdecken ğŸŠ



[h1]Radiation Island[/h1]
from 2016. Actually a survival adventure in an open world.
As a member of the Philadelphia Experiment, you're stranded in a parallel universe, at least that shows the intro video that's not bad at all.
The graphics are not bad but they are not good either .... This is the general problem with this game, everything is not really good but nothing is really bad.
In the beginning it takes some getting used to with the equipment, but with time it gets better, you have to figure out what you make in this game and what you can do with what. Overall, it could be more extensive because there are not many things to produce.
Note: I did not use the build menu because I only played for 4 hours ... but I listened and I can tell you that some components are not quite compatible with the ground and some parts are difficult to put together.
You will probably have to find out for yourself how it is with the bad people on this island, you do not want to take the last bit of tension, just so much .... You can not discuss with them.
Something like an atmosphere or aura that surrounds you in the game is missing completely, if you forget the annoying music.
Scenically, it is quite suitable as a walking simulator, for those of you I say, all right, especially because it is cheap from the price.
I attached this picture

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1848709238

to tell you more about how it is with the consumption of food ... Once tower looked up through all the empty spaces in some boxes and back down .... Makes 2x food together since you have already consumed half of your hunger display. In other words, you have been forced to constantly foraging and eating every few minutes .....
Who would like that? not me....
So is my rating, rather bad ....
Since the game is no longer in the development stage and no one else cares about it as it seems, I clearly advise against the purchase. Especially since the developers have given up the PC port. Originally I had the thumbs up because it has different starting possibilities. But after watching live broadcasts for hours, I had to rethink my decision.
Except for a few players a clear NO, not buying.

My group and my archive with over 2,300 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

author: {'steamid': '76561198093363439', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1615427985}
review: I honestly really love this game, and the entire concept. I first found it on mobile, and got the free version and got as far as I could on there, before buying it on both Steam and the Nintendo Eshop for my switch. I do really wish that the developers would work a bit more on it, because it does still have quite a few glitches here and there. Sometimes the mouse calibration is off quite a bit, so when I click on something it actually selects the thing beside it. Then, if i'm trying to craft something, sometimes the crafting sound gets stuck in a loop and I hear it over and over until I restart the game. Overall, though, I enjoy the game quite a bit. It has a lot of good mechanics, and survival tactics. The graphics are actually pretty good as well. Though, the AI could be better. Instead of having to be spotted by enemies, they come after you if you're within a certain radius of them, even if there's a small mountain between you and the enemy with no possible way it could see you. It definitely needs quite a bit of work, but regardless I'd recommend. It's great for the price, and honestly pretty addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010127431', 'num_games_owned': 1180, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1562460562}
review:
I like survival and crafting games like these.  It showed up in my discovery que one day, and I thought, "Radiation Island?  That's kind of a lame name...." but the trailer looked fun enough; kind of like playing in a B-rated horror movie.  I wishlisted it, and some time later it went on sale, so I picked it up.

I thought, "I'll just try this out for a while....."  3 hours later, I was still "trying it out."  The first day (in real life) of playing the game, I was just getting a feel for how things went.  The second day, I thought I had it under control pretty well.  The third, I completed the first third of the game, and advanced to the next island.  But on that fourth day, I realized how much harder things got after you left the relative safety of the place where you start.  I had to change my tactics a little, and became aware of how very, very valuable hang-gliders are.

I never got much into base building, because the transit points around the map were quite sufficient for what I needed.  It's nice to know that you can build your own house, if you wanted, but the game seems to attempt to spur you to moving on to the next part, and completing the main objective.

This isn't exactly a 5-star game, but for being developed by an indie team, I think they did a pretty good job.  The game does get a little repetitive, but it feels like you're actually a dude stranded on an island that you didn't want to be on.  There isn't much point to just exploring after you get a machine gun and all the stuff you need to make ammunition, but the game retains is feeling of fun all the way to the end.  Fighting one or two, even three monsters at once isn't really that much of a problem, but eventually you are put in situations where you realize you're ultimately fighting a war of attrition.  In many occasions, it's just more profitable to run.

I would recommend this to anyone looking for about a week or so of fun, surprisingly relaxing yet engaging survival crafting.  If it goes on sale at all, it's certainly worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063574429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1561762372}
review:
Nice survival especially for its price, but if you want something interesting for more than a few hours, i would not recommend it. After first island it is quite boring, you have got pretty much everything you need, crafting is pretty much useless beside ammunition, and the difficulty is scaled by hordes of the same few enemies which sometimes get bigger.
And looking at the last update in 2016 we can safely assume that it is abandoned. If you want some not complicated entertainment for a few hours, take it especially if it is on sale, but if you want something besides that, better find something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155137468', 'num_games_owned': 2939, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1558809484}
review:
Radiation Island is a nice game, some things you have to guess how it works like cuttting grass (get fiber) to make bandages. The Xs on the map are treasure spot, if you make or get a shovel then you can go there dig some treasure.

There's a lot of outposts in the game, so better use that in your favour.

Also you can make a kamikaze run, when you get a tower code you can go there and disable it while trying to avoid enemies. You cannot permanently die, so going kamikaze is safe.

The game is not perfect but is nice playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042266287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1597, 'last_played': 1555967855}
review:
This Game is fun for a lot of reasons

-The building mechanics are simple
-The animal's behaviors are realistic
-There is a good variety of animals and zombies
-The highest difficulty can be very hard and challenging (which is good )

There are some negative points too though

-The zombies move faster than there legs would permit and you cannot outrun them. This makes the game more challenging but also more frustrating so that's not a good thing.

-There are a few bugs who can make the game frustrating at times. One of them is that when you die, the stuff that gets dropped to the ground will disapear if you die a second time. This gets really annoying quickly because lets face it : you gonna die a lot in this game.

*** SPOILER ALERT***

-Once you get through the first island of the game, there are two other identical islands. Although they are not really identical and contains different challenges and different versions of the enemies you've encountered before, it feels like you are replaying the first one over again. You get the feeling that the developpers wanted to extend the game's length without really adding anything new to the game.

But I still recommend it, because I had a lot of fun with it.

review:
Radiation Island est un petit jeu de survie, se dÃ©roulant dans un vaste monde ouvert, abandonnÃ© et infestÃ© de zombies. Portage du jeu mobile du mÃªme nom, les graphismes en souffrent et sont malheureusement trÃ¨s moyens, tandis que la bande son, plutÃ´t insipide, est trÃ¨s rÃ©pÃ©titive. La jouabilitÃ©, au clavier et Ã  la souris, est un peu archaÃ¯que mais correcte, avec des contrÃ´les simples et intuitifs, et qui peuvent Ãªtre modifiÃ©s via le menu des options ; jâ€™ai Ã©galement essayÃ© Ã  la manette mais je trouve que ce nâ€™est pas lâ€™idÃ©al pour ce jeu. A noter quâ€™il est possible de passer dâ€™une vue Ã  la premiÃ¨re personne Ã  une vue Ã  la troisiÃ¨me personne en appuyant simplement sur un bouton. Concernant le scÃ©nario, assez classique, il faut trouver les notes du journal dâ€™un survivant, afin de connaitre lâ€™histoire de lâ€™archipel ainsi que les objectifs Ã  accomplir pour terminer le jeu. Trois niveaux de difficultÃ© (facile, normal et difficile) sont disponibles, et je vais maintenant parler de mon expÃ©rience en mode normal.

Le systÃ¨me dâ€™artisanat est simple et assez diversifiÃ©, mÃªme si une fois un camp Ã©tabli et une mitrailleuse trouvÃ©e, on se contentera de fabriquer des munitions, agrandir son sac Ã  dos, et Ã©ventuellement fabriquer des vÃªtements de protection. En effet, le jeu nâ€™est pas avare en ressources, en Ã©quipements et en fournitures mÃ©dicales ; Ã  noter que la carte est rechargÃ©e en ressources Ã  chaque connexion, et parfois mÃªme les coffres que vous avez dÃ©jÃ  fouillÃ© sont rechargÃ©s, ce qui est un peu surprenant. De mÃªme, la nourriture se trouve abondamment, sachant quâ€™il est possible de chasser et de pÃªcher, ainsi que de cuisiner pour obtenir des aliments de meilleure valeur nutritive. La principale menace Ã  votre survie viendra des diffÃ©rents ennemis, dans un premier temps les animaux sauvages (loups, ours, crocodiles et pumas) qui sont peu nombreux Ã  un mÃªme endroit (maximum trois ou quatre individus) et qui ne se mÃ©langent pas (pas dâ€™ours se baladant avec des loups, ce nâ€™est pas le livre de la jungle), puis dans un deuxiÃ¨me temps les zombies (zombies simples, paysans, soldats, prisonniers et scientifiques) qui peuvent se trouver en assez grande quantitÃ© Ã  un mÃªme endroit et qui se mÃ©langent entre eux ; Ã  noter quâ€™on peut rencontrer des zombies gÃ©ants et des loups cracheurs de projectiles, ce qui est assez ridicule. Suivant lâ€™ennemi rencontrÃ©, vous pouvez, outre vous faire tuer, Ãªtre frappÃ© dâ€™une condition handicapante : saignement, fracture, infection ; Ã  chaque condition, son remÃ¨de, quâ€™on peut soit trouver en explorant, soit fabriquer. Il y a Ã©galement les radiations, dont il faudra se protÃ©ger avec une tenue spÃ©ciale qui recouvre vos vÃªtements, ces tenues se trouvant assez facilement en explorant. Si vous mourrez, vous rÃ©apparaitrez Ã  un point de passage proche, qui sont assez nombreux et facilitent lâ€™exploration ainsi que lâ€™accomplissement des objectifs. Le jeu propose Ã©galement un cycle jour/nuit, avec plus de dangers la nuit, comme lâ€™obscuritÃ© ou le froid, et il est possible de passer de la nuit au jour en dormant dans un lit, quâ€™on peut fabriquer ou trouver dans un point de passage. Malheureusement, lâ€™intÃ©rÃªt de lâ€™exploration devient assez vite limitÃ© et on se contentera dâ€™aller dâ€™objectif en objectif, jusquâ€™Ã  la fin du jeu.

Avec une durÃ©e de vie dâ€™environ quinze heures en mode normal, Radiation Island propose une petite expÃ©rience de survie plutÃ´t correcte, et ce malgrÃ© quelques points nÃ©gatifs, notamment le scÃ©nario qui aurait gagnÃ© Ã  Ãªtre plus fourni en utilisant mieux lâ€™exploration des diffÃ©rents lieux de lâ€™archipel. A noter la prÃ©sence de quelques bugs, pouvant Ãªtre plus ou moins frustrant. AchetÃ© pour un peu plus dâ€™un euro en promotion, cela reste trÃ¨s correct.

review: learning curve is beyond dumb. just started it up and was like well ok this is the normal cheap survival. inventory is wayyyy to small and you need leather to upgrade , leather comes from wolves which will make you bleed on the first hit. have not found the plants to make a bandage at all. zombies hit you with radiation that keep going until you die. ranged weapons just kinda go where they want.

review:
Zombies, annoying music and a lot of wabbits ashore:) 80% of achievements was received within an hour and a little more later. Just last one remains that represents about two-thirds of the content and you've lost motivation to continue...
Surely not the best survival with its primitive techniques/development/content, not the worst though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051245395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1514237285}
review:
Honestly the game falls really short compared to other similar titles. Go buy 7 days to die or The Forest instead. I've played an absurd amount of games in this sort of sandbox genre and this has to be the worst one. 
-Graphics are not quite there
-Little content
-Poor mechanics
-Generally boring

The only thing this really has going for it is the storyline seems pretty interesting but the game was not enough to keep me going. Others might have found something in this game that I have not but for me this is a total bust 

3/10 I would rather get lost on an isle irl

author: {'steamid': '76561198004715757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1530145574}
review: DO NOT BUY! While i had a few hours of fun with this game I just learned, and yes its apparently been up for a while, that the devs have tanked this game and are no longer working on it. This is the issue Steam needs to start worrying about. A company sells their product here, takes all the money they can and then has no intention of finishing said product. How are you still able to charge for a product that you admit you will never finish or work on again?

author: {'steamid': '76561198070954168', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1531073866}
review:
While its a "good" game, its nothing that i'd write home to my family about or nominate for an award. Its just a plain and simple, "good". Not excellent. not superb. just better than bland or bad.
I wish there was something other than the binary STRONG recommending against game or not, because as I wouldn't recommend it right of the bat, it is still a "good" game. Or at the very least passes all mimimum requirements for passing grade. 
If you're looking for a more refined game probably should go elsewhere, but if you're not picky this game should be good enough to entertain you, or at least occupy you.

Once again while not strictly "bad" its nothing I would write home about or nominate for an award.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977260782', 'num_games_owned': 2851, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1528934743}
review: Engrossing, and enjoyable. It's a mobile port, and the difficulty is appropriate for a mobile port. That said, I found it challenging at places, and especially at night. It's quite easy to get started and thriving, but the enemy bases are still difficult and scary to play. I'm still on the first island and for the playtime I think it's worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325616058', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1528058613}
review:
I paid $1.99 and I still feel ripped off.

The zombies run around in circles faster than you can aim and fire, making it just about impossible to hit them.  I've gone through 4 sets of "strong armor" and over 1000 machine gun bullets and it's still not enough.  

Do not buy this.  If you've already bought it, do not play it.

Absolutely awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048361702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1520678496}
review:
Considering it's been 2 years and the devs said in a recent post that they are distancing themselves from Steam and the PC version--in favor of the recent Nintendo Switch release--I'm going to suggest that you don't get this game.

Is it bad? Yes and no. It's got potential, but the enemies are just...not good. The animals behave in weird ways. Bears loop between charging you and running away so long as you don't get too close to them. Wolves charge at you and then switch to a slow prowl just before they reach you. Alligators are a mess; their swim animation just looks like they're floating away, they're slow on land, and they can't seem to climb even the slightest slope. And then there's the zombies, who are actually quite scary because they are really fast but they run around like crazy people in unpredictable patterns (it's pretty terrifying). They only attack if their seemingly random frolicking brings you into their range, but it's really hard to hit them due to their erratic patterns.

I haven't played very much, but the AI in the game is weak. Aside from the zombies, everything is pretty easy to kill, though I haven't got up the courage yet to try the mountain lions. I suspect they'll be just as easy to 'glitch' as the bears and alligators, meaning there's not really much to fear. I like fear, so that's a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316672548', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1695617898}
review: I played this game a ton actually on mobile and it was really good but a bit frusterating (as most FPS games on mobile are) i was waiting for it to come out on pc and just recently bought it and am very happy with it. So far i havent seen any major bugs. What made me stop playing the mobile version is a massive and annoying bug that most people were experiencing. Whenever the game would crash (which was a good amount especially if you have a horrible phone) there was around a 25% chance you would lose everything in your chests. That does not happen in this one and i am very pleased. This game is not for everyone, if you like to play games that have the unfinished feel and kind of old feel this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055968959', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1332, 'last_played': 1518978169}
review:
Si te gustan los juegos de supervivencia, este te va a gustar. Si no tienes un ordenador puntero, incluso lo podrÃ¡s jugar. A mÃ­ se me laguea mucho el Rust, incluso a veces se apaga, pero puedo jugar a este sin problemas.

Pros:
- No se necesita un ordenador puntero.
- Supervivencia con historia.
- Se puede poner tanto en primera como en tercera persona.
- Tiene su punto justo de dificultad.
- Tiene cosas secundarias, como cavar para encontrarte municiÃ³n y cosas de interÃ©s

Contras:
- Tiene bugs, muchos. En la montaÃ±a, a una distancia entre, por ejemplo, la tierra y el suelo de la casucha, hay veces que me ha matado sin motivo alguno. Eso por no decir que habÃ­a enemigos que se teletransportaban (cuando no tenÃ­an por quÃ©)
- Se supone que es un juego con historia. La historia te la encuentras en notitas, solo hay que apagar torres. Un poco pobre para ser para un jugador. A veces, incluso tienes que suponer lo que hacer a continuaciÃ³n, se pierde mucho con que te dejen la historia como un "supÃ³n lo prÃ³ximo que tienes que hacer".
- Para un jugador hasta que te pasas el juego, que ya no tiene mÃ¡s misterio, juntado con que no hay comunidad para multijugador con este juego.
- Dificultad al principio para obtener municiÃ³n, cuando mucho mÃ¡s tarde, los zombies te la regalan. Tanto tiempo para que despuÃ©s no me cabe la municiÃ³n en el inventario.
- CreaciÃ³n de casas nefasta... se dejan huecos y tienes que construir paredes en los huecos, aunque quÃ© le vamos a pedir a un single player...

En resumen, y a pesar de los contras... si no puedes jugar ni al Rust ni al Ark ni al 7 Days to Die... este juego te puede "quitar el gusanillo.... las 23 horas reales que le he metido al juego jajajaja. IncreÃ­ble, pero sÃ­, lo recomendarÃ­a.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041178432', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1518920283}
review:
I have refunded the game, but I want you to read what I have to say.

This is not a bad game, far from it, it's actually quite good for it's genre.The thing you need to know going in is that this IS a port of a mobile survival game for iPhones, but at that it is almost certainly one of the best ones you could possibly get. 
That being said, it will come with all of the typical janky bugs and odd design choices you can expect from that. 
It IS fun, it is an interesting world to explore and survive, and it is DEFINITELY worth $5. 

The gameplay is rather solid, albeit clearly designed for mobile phones the port work is solid. 
Radiation Island also has remarkably good graphics for a low budget survival title, a solid story and decent balance. It can actually be rather scary, and there will be situations you might decide to avoid outright because you can't handle them yet. The atmosphere feels unreal, with odd soundscapes, a tropical island that gives way to deserted military bases and small towns. 
It's just that I wasn't very engaged with it for a while. If you've played a lot of early access survival games you will know what to expect, janky animations, a large amount of the game being traversing similarily textured hills and woods, if you are alright with that, this is the game for you. 

I am not that person though, and although I may return to buy it again later, it's just not for me.

tl;dr It's a port of a mobile survival game, but probably the best it could be considering that. 

Thank you, Atypical Games for granting my refund request, I did enjoy Radiation island, but atm I would rather spend that $3 on something else. You did a great job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102404687', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1523081246}
review:
Played a bit, so far I like it ok.
For the price it is an unpolished gem.
Runs smoothly on a low end PC while still looking ok.
Crafting and survival is surprisingly entertaining.
I found two main issues that bother me so far:
- AI pathfinding 
   It is pretty sketchy, mobs get stuck easily. It is ok with zombies, they are not too smart, but wolves shouldn't get stuck trying to get around a skinny treetrunk :P
- The rain 
   It rains *inside* buildings too. Come on people. While this is not a gamebreaker, this bothers the hell outta me, ruins the feel of looking for shelter from the elements totally. 

Still, worth piddling with, see where the story mode takes me.

-------- EDIT --------

Initially gave it a 7/10, Gonna knock it down to 3/10.

- the mobs are horrendously clunky
- the samurai sword zombie is running up and down at the speed of a car, more annoying than challenging
- some crafting ideas are silly beyond bearable, like being able to manufacture centerfire brass cased ammo from lead, sulfur and charcoal with your bare hands, etc.
- obviously ported from touchscreen platforms, rifle aiming is doofus.
- coulda come up with decent icons for "titanium" tools (you smelt titanium in a rock stove :P ), instead of just tinting the stone ones blue.

There are a lot other shortcomings too that I'm not going to list, the creators are obviously not communicating with the players. 
This game is not as advertised.

PROs are low price and low spec HW, still I'm gonna try to get a refund.

Too bad, the basic premise of the game is pretty good.

review: Bueno Bueno Bueno,Un juego que no funciona...No digo que esta mal,solo que hay un problema de compatibilidad,Al abrirlo me dice algo de no se que de OpenGL,que necesito una version mas reciente y actualizar los drivers,Instalo aplicaciones al azar de actualizar drivers [Todos Los Drivers Estan Actualizados] Despues me instalo el OpenGL,y adivina,no funciona,en una version de Windows 7 Home Premium creo,me funcionÃ³,yo todo alegre esperando a que se abra el juego,aparece la pantalla en blanco,se oyen sonidos y no pasa nada,cuando uso el teclado,oigo como que se oyen los pasos de mi personaje,y otros sonidos.Pero aun sigue viendose en Blanco,No se que problema es esto,Ah,Y veis esos minutos registrados en el juego? Todo ese tiempo he estado "Moviendome" en todos los lugares,sin saber que cojÃ­nes esta pasando y porque hay una pantalla blanca,la verdad,me parece una perdida de tiempo instalar el juego y mirar la pantalla blanca mientras "caminas" por toda la "zona"

author: {'steamid': '76561197984664995', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1673795881}
review:
Getting this in the sale I was expecting a half finished mess for a dollar. What I got was quite playable and even enjoyabe.. It's no rust or anything, but for what I paid I was pleased. You can craft basic stuff for tools, make shelter & what not. Things are hard to find, and that can be a pain when youre hungry. It seems to be a pretty large map from what ive played in the first hour or so. Died a few times of hunger, 6/10 Will play again.


*Edit*
After 20+ hours I would have to give this game a solid 7/10.. Its pretty damn addictive once you get yourself figured out. The only real grievances I have are the limited ai models (animals & Z's, only maybe a dozen or so different "creatures") and it seems to rain through the roofs of everything. Luckily being wet doesnt seem to affect health or anything, but it can be a real mood breaker when you run inside to get out of a massive thunderstorm only to have it keep raining on you. If this game had workshop access or mods, i would even go so far as an 8/10.. custom skins & things would really do well for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010125722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1514940658}
review:
TLDR: The game is pre-alpha. Bad controls, bad menu navigations, takes the excitement away quickly. I wanted to know more what the story and the rest of the world could offer, but the damn contols really killed it for me.

There is a reason why this game is so cheap. The positive reviewers are most likely either paid or kindly asked for their reviews.

There is a story in this game, but I could not focus enough on it to figure much out as I was constantly getting frustrated and confused by the controls and mechanics of the game. You have to press spesific keys to open spesific pages. You cannot do stuff quickly unless you play for a number of hours and get used to the keys. Where is the good old "tab" key that opens up a menu where you can select between inventory, crafting menu, etc.?

Controls are terrible. You can often find yourself falling from an edge because your character decided to slide over the rusty metal floor for some reason. Don't even try to jump in a creative way.

So far I have seen reviews stating that the enemies pose threats. - I have spent couple of nights outside in the forest, killed wolves (1 arrow for each) and killed a bear (3 arrows), while I only took damage from the bear, which I did not even have to do anything about. So, yeah. Real stuff.

(A sheep dropped a chicken leg)

Well it might be too late to tell the developers to fix the controls, but if you can kindly fix the controls, I would definetly recommend this game, at least for its exploration purposes.

review: Solo puedo decir que es un gran juego, muy entretenido y versÃ¡til, apenas empezado te da cosas que hacer y sientes la verdadera necesidad de sobrevivir, de buscar comida, de buscar ropa, de tener algo con que defenderte y mucho mÃ¡s, el crafting se hace muy cÃ³modo y la ambientaciÃ³n de misterio estÃ¡ en todas partes, hay problemas con la IA de los enemigos, y se podria mejorar sus graficos, pero son cosas menores y esto es lo mÃ¡s triste, se ve que por parte de sus creadores, no ha recibido en mucho tiempo el debido cuidado, parches o cosas que lo hagan mejor, quizÃ¡s en un principio no tuvo el recibimiento deseado, ya que habÃ­an otros survivals que fueron mÃ¡s promocionados que este, pero espero que se tome en consideraciÃ³n por la gente que gusta de los juegos de supervivencia, En fin, entretenido, su precio es bueno y mÃ¡s ahora en las rebajas, cÃ³mpralo, pruÃ©balo y disfruta :D.

review:
Merece um lugar em sua biblioteca, apesar de aparentar ser um genÃ©rico do gÃªnero sobrevivÃªncia o jogo nao torna-se comum em relaÃ§Ã£o aos demais jogos desse gÃªnero. A jogabilidade Ã© um ponto positivo do jogo, tudo funciona suavemente e sem engasgos na dinÃ¢mica, alem disso, a variedade de itens Ã© algo a ser considerado nesse jogo. O ponto negativo seria o fato de o jogo apresentar incopatibilidade com vÃ¡rios computadores, deixando a maioria dos gamers frutrados ao tentarem joga-lo. nÃ£o existe um ''multiplayer'', e sim a possibilidade de jogar contra outro player, invadindo o mundo dele.

Com todos os problemas ou nÃ£o o Radiation Island Ã© uma boa opÃ§Ã£o para passar um tempo tentando sair da ilha ou se adaptando a ela.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156078582', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1706902194}
review:
I want everyone reading this to keep in mind that this is A MOBILE APP, that was essensially ported to PC.

This game is great for the cost. The Envirnment and graphics are fantastic. I have been a fan of the game ever since i got it on iOS. 
There is so much to do and to explore, the progression of the game is great. At first i was completely unaware of their being more than one island.
The game is actually difficult, military bases and tesla towers are fun to raid. 
The Digging for treasure feature is a nice touch. It is a great way to get items, probably the most efficient way.
The transit locations are a nice touch as it can be difficult to move around.
"Vehicles" that naturally spawn such as gliders and boats are a good way of getting around. I have remembered some of the possitions of these objects to use it to my advantage.

Overall this game is great. Again, keep in mind this was a mobile app simply being ported onto PC. I hope the sequal, Radiation City, gets released on steam as well. I have downloaded it on my iPhone however i have yet to play it yet as I redownloaded Radiation Island and want to complete that first.

Yes very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170399277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1579574341}
review: Besides the awkward animations, the game is very fun. The enemies in the game are unique and actually pose a threat. The giant military bases are fun to raid, and it always pays off. The story is pretty interesting and the islands are gorgeous. I wish the developers would add more things to this game, cause after the story there is pretty much nothing to do, and you are basically invincible by the end of the game. If some sort of DLC came out or atleast new zombies, animals or weapons, that would be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066585213', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1703058831}
review:
Date of Review: October 6, 2017
Time Played: Nearly 7 Hours
Skill Level: Master

BFYP: You have to complete the story before you can play the multiplayer.

Combat: The overall Combat is quite basic. That's until you dunk off and find yourself being chased by 4 bears with a slingshot and bow. Or a pack of wolves and an axe. or 30 zombies shooting at you with viruses and being chased by 7-8 soliders with 2 hit kill powers.  Even though it is not a 7DTD game, it sure feels like it. Always an enemy, wether man or beast, at least you have a machinegun. 3 hits to kill in hardmode. Not much  to hold off for until they are up you're arse crack. So either play serious when entering combat or die really fast,

Crafting: The crafting is easy as hell. I mean if you don't have medicine by day 5 your way behind, getting an iron shovel and guns is a different story completly. decide to build your house in a Transit zone so that you don't get it destroyed and you can have a crystal converter. Finding the right stuff on the other hand can be hard AF. 

Building: Not hard, really nice of you do it at a Transit so you can always travel there faster and use the converter. The idea of it is their base is too small and you can build it to huge proportions. It is easy to get materials sometimes. Other times not so true.

Story: Not like most games with shit cutscenes and boring none important animation, this has a solid expalantion for eveerything that is happening if you can take 5 hours to finding everything in the journal and taking it to the next level and getting to the center island and activating teloporter.

Enviroment: HUGE MAP, Well crafted mostly. I mean it is huge, and either you boat your way around and through or you use a hangglider and fly over it. Or you can be a loser and run. Your choice, But overall the whole place is well worth the way to play multiplayer...

MP: Have not got that far to unlock it.

Enemies: DON'T FUCK WITH THE BIG GUYS, THEY WILL RAPE THE FUCK OUT OF YOU. 

Overall: Don't get overwhelmed liek you are paying $3 for the best survival game ever. But it helps get your average acheivement score up and lets you see what a mobile port has to offer. I mean come the fuck on. It was before Rust and 7DTD even came out and you get a $3 version of it without loosing anything. It has trading cards and a huge map. Definetly worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000112165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1502058984}
review:
[h1]Details[/h1]
[quote]
[h1]Pacific grin: lose yourself in this toxic island survival adventure.[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1238222572
A well-structured game of survival and exploration as you try to assemble a way off Radiation Island, avoiding the marauding gangs of 1950s Japanese Army zombies and bases. A FPS shooter with limited camp-building capabilities, lots of scavenging and some cool vehicles.
[/quote]
[h1]Summary[/h1]
[quote]
[h1]Incredibly playable, nicely placed, achievements all attainable and great fun. highly recommended!.[/h1]
Pros:
- great atmosphere, very good music and wonderfully rendered 'Japanese WWII Military' environments 
- some of the enemies are really scary
- tough-as-nails, but very rewarding
- a game where there is no speaking or dumb cutscene exposition: just kill, find next objective and survive

Cons:
- watch wildlife try and climb mountains after you - LOL
- passwords, seriously? should randomise this stuff otherwise you google it: seemed a dumb way to pad out length of game.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1748253455
[/quote]
[h1]See Also...[/h1]
https://store.steampowered.com/app/242880/
[h1]All [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/boyflea/][i]boyflea[/i][/url] reviews can be found at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33138741-Good-Indie-Free-Game-Reviews/][b]Good Indie Free Game Reviews[/b] [/url][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027530154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1500921329}
review:
GefÃ¤llt mir sehr gut. Die Grafik ist etwas schlicht und am Anfang braucht man etwas, bis man sich mit den Resourcen zurecht findet. Aber hat man erstmal seine GrundausrÃ¼stung zusammen, geht es ans erkunden der Insel. Man findet immer wieder Tagebuchseiten die die Story voran treiben und die nÃ¤chsten Ziele festlegen. Ganz gute AtmosphÃ¤re und wie ich finde eine gewisse Grundspannung vorhanden. Da ich mich nirgends Ã¼ber das Spiel informiert habe, weiÃŸ ich auch nicht im voraus um was es geht und muss alles selbst raus finden.
Alles in allem ein recht nettes Spiel, den niedirgen Preis alle mal wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011858893', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1494374552}
review:
WOW !

For the price of this game, it is amazing.

I can see myself in this game for a long while.

This would be awesome and I mean AWESOME, if it was an online MMO **without PVP** where people can trade items, etc.

All the open world survival games I have seen have PvP in them.

I been looking for a game like this, that is open world sandbox, MMO without PvP.
Yet this is not MMO. Would be awesome if it was, just for trading, etc.

For the silly low price this game is, most people would enjoy it if they are into open world, walking simulation, survival and crafting.

The crafting is great, the open world and scenery is great.
Killing, well I am testing it on low level, creatures can't fight back. So I can not comment, yet level 2 and 3 are look better when you got to grips with the game, where the creatures fight back, etc, etc.
So I can't really comment on that part, yet if the game so far is anything to go by, I am in for a treat ;)

All I can say is this is an excellent game for the price.

Please, Please, Please, make this an MMO without the PvP, just for trading and grouping, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072269496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1507827142}
review:
EDIT: The price is now 9.99. Is it still worth buying? In my opinion, yeah. For 19.99 you can get Rocket League, for perspective. You can get a lot more entertained hours out of Rocket League than this game.

[h1]Before playing:[/h1]
I played this game for a while on iOS and was astounded to find it available on Steam! I loved it on iOS, I'm sure it will be even better for PC. I will update this review when I put more gameplay time into it.

[h1]After playing:[/h1]
So I beat the game and got all of the achievements. The game was great for the price. It only crashed three times in the amount of time it took me to play through the story (seven hours). The third crash set me back a bit (I was working on getting to the last tesla tower).

I do not see much replay value, however, there is likely some fun to be had in continuing playing the open-world portion of the game. There is a multiplayer option with a scarce amount of people who actively play it. If there is anyone on, there is a high chance that they are a hacker. It is also kind of repetitive walking constantly to the radiation towers, it is probably something that takes up a quarter of play time.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
[list]
[*]There is a cool base-building system that I used, but not much. It can probably introduce a lot of a playtime as it is fun to build and you can do a good amount with it. I may come back to this game just to use it more. It is similar to Rust's base-building.
[*]Graphics are incredible for a game that costed 2.99.
[*]I can run this game with >200 FPS on maxed out graphical settings.
[*]The game supports 144hz, you have to go into the configuration file yourself and set the VSync value to zero, however.
[*]Massive amount of content for itâ€™s price.
[*]Cool animations, the â€œold rifleâ€ (the bolt action rifle) has a nice satisfying reload animation.
[*]Interesting storyline, based off of a real life conspiracy theory (Philadelphia Experiment)[/list]                            
[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Looting is generally bland.
[*]Game seems to have been abandoned by the developers.
[*]In my seven hours of gameplay, I've had three crashes occur.
[*]The multiplayer is bland and I do not think there is a way to communicate with other players but it is better than getting nothing.[/list]

[h1]Other things that should be mentioned:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Not much variety of items (not a big deal.)
[*]Gameplay is somewhat repetitive (most survival games are like this.) 
[*]The multiplayer is also potentially unoptimized. In the short while I played it I noticed that people shake around in place. This may not be the games fault as it could be a result of ping.[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968756327', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1503032739}
review:
[h1] Irradiated. Not All Glow Is Bad. [/h1]

Radiation Island is a true gem. For $3, you get a ridiculous amount of content: A full fledged open world survial crafting game with a loose story to tie it all in. It isn't as complicated or deep as a game like 7 Days to Die or The Forest, but this is what make it truly remarkable.  

The game is light on crafting, giving you all the options from the start, with most of your more powerful weapons being found in marked treasure chests on the map. There are base building options for the hardcore, but most will find it easier to fast travel to a home base as soon as night hits. 

The visuals aren't anything extraordinary, but Radiation Island makes up for it with a very daunting and creepy atmosphere. Day/Night cycles and constantly varying weather patterns keep things fresh, while random radiation clouds spring up at random to give the island a feeling of "science and technology gone wrong." Great sound effects compliment it all very well, more so when you play with a decent headset, and keep things spooky.

It's hard to recommend Radiation Island because I find it hard to explain why I enjoy it so much myself. Keep your expectations low and realize this isn't aiming to be next gen by any means. It's great for what it's worth, and I can honestly say I've played similar yet terrible titles at 10 times the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983952515', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1486267539}
review: This is the first exploration/survival game I've tried, and I picked it up becuase it was only ~$3.  Wow, this may be the best purchase I've made in a while.  Super fun.  It took me a while to figure out how to sort of survivie and what I could craft, but I never felt lost or punished for exploring and the game makes it reallt clear where you can and should go as you're learning.  There is no level system, just better gear you can find/make.  After a little more than 7 hours in, I feel like I am well equipped to suruve and really begin to push out and explore without worrying about running away from things.  I am really enjoying this game.  I would say that the soundtrack, while wonderfully atmospheric only contains about 15 minutes of unique music, so prepare for it to loop, a lot.  Aside from that, this is simple to get into a slighlty more complex as you explore the world.  One note, you can click on the 'compass' looking icons on the map to fast travel, took me forever to fiure that out.  But I would recommend this game for sure.  Real fun and I keep coming back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974244450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1504438145}
review:
This is a hidden gem. For Â£1.99 I was not expecting much but the video looked interesting and it had many positive reviews so I thought I would give it a go. I'm hooked on it. The simplicity of the interface works for me and I love the lack of starting inventory slots. Makes you plan ahead on what resources you are going to need. Anyway, inventory space can be expanded by "upgrading" your backpack.

Must be played with headphones. When that claw turns red and the music kicks in it's panic and brown trousers time.

Give it a go. For a survival horror it's dirt cheap and fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174488661', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1682580988}
review: This is one of the best games i have ever played. The lore/story is completely original. The graphics might not be so good but is makes the game more fun. It has realism in almost all genres of living in the wild (exept the zombies). Except for minor bugs this game is worth a lot more than it costs. Thank you (the creator I mean) for making such an awesome game.
